meanings.definition: The activity or profession of writing plays.
meanings.sent1: Her passion for playwrighting led her to write numerous successful plays.
meanings.sent2: I have always been interested in playwrighting and hope to become a playwright one day.
meanings.sent3: After years of playwrighting, she finally achieved her dream of having a play performed on Broadway.
meanings.sent4: The art of playwrighting is like weaving a tapestry of words that come to life on stage.
meanings.sent5: His dedication to playwrighting shone through in every line of dialogue he wrote.

meanings.definition: The act of creating or producing a play.
meanings.sent1: Playwrighting involves not just writing the script but also overseeing its production.
meanings.sent2: The success of a play often depends on the quality of its playwrighting.
meanings.sent3: The playwrighting for the school play was a collaborative effort among the drama club members.
meanings.sent4: The playwrighting process can be challenging but ultimately rewarding.
meanings.sent5: The playwrighting for the new musical was praised for its originality and creativity.

meanings.definition: The skill or practice of writing plays.
meanings.sent1: She honed her playwrighting skills through years of practice and dedication.
meanings.sent2: Effective playwrighting requires a deep understanding of storytelling and character development.
meanings.sent3: His quirky sense of humor always shines through in his playwrighting.
meanings.sent4: The playwrighting workshop helped aspiring writers improve their craft.
meanings.sent5: Her passion for playwrighting was evident in the emotion and depth of her characters.
